comments.text:
It seems that these two methods are used once each:

Getter:
https://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/accessible/src/html/nsHTMLFormControlAccessible.cpp#308

Setter:
https://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/content/html/content/src/nsHTMLTextAreaElement.cpp#438

The getter use case call a method that is calling nsGfxButtonControlFrame::GetDefaultLabel:
https://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/layout/forms/nsGfxButtonControlFrame.cpp#196

It seems wrong to have that in the layout code, it's obviously related to content. Actually, the caller of GetFormProperty has a content, get the frame, call GetFormProperty on the frame which gets the content to call check the answer...

When the setter is called, this method is called:
https://mxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/layout/forms/nsTextControlFrame.cpp#731

It seems to do more serious thing but maybe a new method should be added to nsITextControlFrame instead of using SetFormProperty?
comments.creator: mounir@lamouri.fr

Oups, sounds like I missed two setters in nsHTMLInputElement:
The first one is exactly like the previous mentioned setter.
The seconde one is to send <input type='file'> value to the frame. I guess this could be part of nsIFormControlFrame?
